section.sectiontext: Nursing is designated for the purposes of the Act.
The name of the college established for nursing is the "College of Registered Nurses of British Columbia".

subsection.subsectiontext: No person other than a registrant may use the title "nurse", "registered nurse" or "licensed graduate nurse".
No person other than a nurse practitioner may use the title "nurse practitioner" or "registered nurse practitioner".
All nurse practitioners may be known by the title "registered nurse".
This section does not prevent a person from using the title "nurse" in a manner authorized by another regulation under section 12 of the Act.

section.sectiontext: It is a limit or condition on the provision or performance by a registrant of a service that the registrant provide or perform the service in accordance with all standards, limits and conditions for the practice of nursing in relation to that service established by the board.
The college is designated for the purposes of section 16 (2) (f) of the Act.

subsection.subsectiontext: A registrant in the course of practising nursing may

paragraph.paragraphtext: make a nursing diagnosis identifying a condition as the cause of the signs or symptoms of the individual,
for the purpose of wound care, perform a procedure on tissue below the dermis or below the surface of a mucous membrane,
for the purposes of collecting a blood sample or donation, perform venipuncture,
for the purposes of establishing intravenous access, maintaining patency or managing hypovolemia,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: perform venipuncture, or
administer a solution by instillation through a parenteral method,

paragraph.paragraphtext: administer

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: oxygen or humidified air by inhalation, or
nutrition by instillation through an enteral method,

paragraph.paragraphtext: for the purposes of assessing an individual or ameliorating or resolving a condition identified through the making of a nursing diagnosis, administer a solution

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: by irrigation, or
by instillation through an enteral method,

paragraph.paragraphtext: for the purposes of assessing an individual or ameliorating or resolving a condition identified through the making of a nursing diagnosis, put an instrument or a device, hand or finger

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: into the external ear canal, up to the eardrum,
beyond the point in the nasal passages where they normally narrow,
beyond the pharynx,
beyond the opening of the urethra,
beyond the labia majora,
beyond the anal verge, or
into an artificial opening into the body,

paragraph.paragraphtext: for the purposes of assessing an individual or ameliorating or resolving a condition identified through the making of a nursing diagnosis, put into the external ear canal, up to the eardrum,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: air that is under pressure created by the use of an otoscope, or
water that is under pressure created by the use of an ear bulb syringe,

paragraph.paragraphtext: apply ultrasound for the purposes of bladder volume measurement, blood flow monitoring or fetal heart monitoring,
apply electricity using an automatic external defibrillator,
compound, dispense or administer by any method a drug specified in Schedule II of the Drug Schedules Regulation, B.C. Reg. 9/98, or
dispense or administer the following drugs specified in Schedule I of the Drug Schedules Regulation, B.C. Reg. 9/98:

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: epinephrine, for the purpose of treating anaphylaxis;
dextrose in concentrated solutions for parenteral nutrition, for the purpose of treating hypoglycemia.

subsection.subsectiontext: Section 9 (2) does not apply to the provision or performance by a registrant of a service that includes the provision or performance of an activity described in subsection (1).

subsection.subsectiontext: A registrant in the course of practising nursing may

paragraph.paragraphtext: perform a procedure on tissue below the dermis, below the surface of a mucous membrane or in or below the surface of the cornea,
administer a substance, other than a drug that is specified in a Schedule of the Drug Schedules Regulation, B.C. Reg. 9/98,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: by injection,
by inhalation,
by mechanical ventilation,
by irrigation, or
by instillation through an enteral or parenteral method,

paragraph.paragraphtext: put an instrument or a device, hand or finger

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: into the external ear canal, up to the eardrum,
beyond the point in the nasal passages where they normally narrow,
beyond the pharynx,
beyond the opening of the urethra,
beyond the labia majora,
beyond the anal verge, or
into an artificial opening into the body,

paragraph.paragraphtext: put into the external ear canal, up to the ear drum, a substance that is under pressure,
apply electricity for the purposes of

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: cardioversion, including defibrillation,
adjusting a pacemaker,
adjusting or setting implanted cardiac devices, or
electro-cauterization,

paragraph.paragraphtext: compound, dispense or administer by any method a drug specified in Schedule I or IA of the Drug Schedules Regulation, B.C. Reg. 9/98,
design or compound a therapeutic diet if nutrition is administered through an enteral method,
conduct allergy challenge testing or allergy desensitizing treatment that involves injection, scratch tests or inhalation,
conduct allergy challenge testing by any method if the individual being tested has had a previous anaphylactic reaction, or
conduct a cardiac stress test for the purposes of diagnosis and treatment planning.

subsection.subsectiontext: The following limits or conditions apply to the provision or performance by a registrant of a service that includes the provision or performance of an activity described in subsection (1):

paragraph.paragraphtext: the registrant must not provide or perform the service except for the purpose of complying with an order;
before the provision or performance of the service,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the health professional who gives the order must be authorized under an enactment to provide or perform the service, and
the registrant must be authorized under the Act, the regulations and the bylaws to provide or perform the service.

subsection.subsectiontext: A registrant in the course of practising nursing may

paragraph.paragraphtext: provide or perform an activity described in section 9 (1), except compound, dispense or administer a drug specified in Schedule 1A of the Drug Schedules Regulation, B.C. Reg. 9/98,
make a diagnosis identifying a disease, disorder or condition as the cause of the signs or symptoms of the individual,
manage normal labour in an institutional setting if the primary maternal care provider is absent or unavailable, or
give an order to apply X-ray for diagnostic or imaging purposes, except X-ray for computerized axial tomography.

subsection.subsectiontext: Section 9 (2) does not apply to the provision or performance by a registrant of a service that includes the provision or performance of an activity described in subsection (1) (a), if the registrant is certified in respect of that service as described in subsection (3).

It is a limit or condition on the provision or performance by a registrant of a service that includes the provision or performance of an activity described in subsection (1) that, before providing or performing the service, the registrant has successfully completed a certification program established or approved by or under the bylaws to ensure registrants are qualified and competent to provide or perform that service in the practice setting in which it is to be provided or performed by the registrant.

Despite sections 9 and 10, a registrant in the course of practising nursing who has not successfully completed a certification program described in section 10 (3) may provide or perform an activity described in section 10 (1) if

paragraph.paragraphtext: the registrant is an employee,
it is a condition of the registrant's employment that the registrant be authorized by the college to practise nursing,
the activity is provided or performed in the course of fulfilling the registrant's employment duties, and
the registrant's employer

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: requires, on the date this regulation comes into force, the activity to be provided or performed by a registrant in the course of fulfilling a registrant's employment duties, or

has declared to the minister, on or before the date that is 30 days after the date this regulation comes into force, an intention to require the activity be provided or performed by a registrant in the course of fulfilling a registrant's employment duties.

subsection.subsectiontext: This section is repealed on January 1, 2009.
A nurse practitioner in the course of practising nursing may

paragraph.paragraphtext: provide or perform an activity described in section 9 (1), except compound, dispense or administer a drug specified in Schedule 1A of the Drug Schedules Regulation, B.C. Reg. 9/98,
provide or perform an activity described in section 10 (1) (b) to (d),
set or cast a closed simple fracture of a bone, or reduce a dislocation of a joint,
apply X-ray for diagnostic or imaging purposes, except X-ray for computerized axial tomography,
give an order to apply one or more of the following forms of energy:

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: ultrasound for diagnostic or imaging purposes, including any application of ultrasound to a fetus;
X-ray for computerized axial tomography, or

paragraph.paragraphtext: prescribe or give an order to compound, dispense or administer by any method a drug that is specified in Schedule I or II of the Drug Schedules Regulation, B.C. Reg. 9/98.

subsection.subsectiontext: Section 9 (2) or 10 (3) does not apply to the provision or performance by a nurse practitioner of a service that includes the provision or performance of an activity described in subsection (1) (a) or (b).

It is a limit or condition on the provision or performance by a nurse practitioner of a service that includes the provision or performance of an activity described in subsection (1) that the nurse practitioner provide or perform the service in accordance with all standards, limits and conditions for the practice of nursing by nurse practitioners in relation to that service established by the board on the recommendation of a committee that

paragraph.paragraphtext: is established under section 19 (1) (t) of the Act, and
has the duty and power to develop and recommend standards, limits or conditions for the practice of nursing by nurse practitioners.

subsection.subsectiontext: It is a limit or condition on the provision or performance by a registrant of a service that includes the provision or performance of an activity described in subsection (1) (c) to (f) that the registrant be a nurse practitioner.
